About Me

A few tidbits for a closer look...

BIO

Hospitality professional turned Web Developer? Yep, that's me. Not counting 2 years as an SAP R/3 user and supply chain analyst, my career up to 2018 was spent mastering the restaurant industry managing teams from 3 to 100. Now I'm conquering new challenges in the world of code. May 2018 I began my junior developer position managing content for multiple corporate websites. I put my newly-acquired knowledge in HTML and CSS to work as I navigated my way through the Wordpress ecosystem. Now, equipped with Javascript, Python, and MySql I look forward to contributing as a full stack developer in my next role. On the personal side, I'm a self-admitted bandwagon-fan of MCU, GOT, and Modern Combat 5.

Code

Code is at the core of so much that I do. It's work, recreation, and my escape all in one. Early mornings and late nights are just part of the equation when it comes to building out my next project.

Community

I've been so priveledged to not only attend Coding meetups, but to be the organizer for one as well. Code Connective is largely responsible for my first junior developer position so I feel it's only right to give back to what's given so much to me.

Connect

What brings me joy? The thrill of talking about tech careers or teaching programming fundamentals to a group of young people. From the public school system to non-profits like Black Girls Code and Code Crew, anywhere I can touch a young life always feels great.
